CenterEdge Software Paytronix Integration API (0.0.0-replace)

Brant Burnett: bburnett@centeredgesoftware.com License: See license agreement

CenterEdge Software Integration with Paytronix API

Post

Post a check

The check post request allows for a full POS check to be submitted to the PXS diagnostic or data analysis purposes, as well as the recording of billing events for our order and delivery integrations.

Authorizations:
bearer_auth
Request Body schema: application/json
required

The check to post

merchantId
required
integer

Paytronix-assigned merchant ID to perform the operation in.

storeCode
required
string

A short code to uniquely identify the store where this transaction occurred.

check
required
object

POS check to post.

http://example.com/api/v1/check/post

Request samples

  • Payload
Content type
application/json
{
  • "merchantId": 1107,
  • "storeCode": "corp",
  • "check": { }
}

PostAndAccruePoints

Post a check and accrue points

The check post and accrue points with redeem request is meant to follow a call to POST check/simulateAccrualAndRedemption.json, enabling you to choose the discounts that are applied. These will be passed in through the Check object. Its arguments are almost identical to the POST check/postAndAccruePointsWithAutoRedeem.json endpoint, merely requiring the addition of a receiptSettings object, and not needing the autoActivateCard argument. If successfull, it will return a receipt.

Authorizations:
bearer_auth
Request Body schema: application/json
required

The check to post

merchantId
required
integer

Paytronix-assigned merchant ID to perform the operation in.

storeCode
required
string

A short code to uniquely identify the store where this transaction occurred.

agentName
string

The agent name. Used if a store has more than one POS system.

check
required
object

POS check to post.

cardInfo
required
object

Card to accrue points for.

autoActivateCard
required
boolean
Default: false

True if the card should automatically be activated if it is not already active. Defaults to false

terminal
required
string

Number of the POS terminal where the check was submitted for accrual, usually by closing the check. Use "0" if the terminal is unknown or unavailable. Maximum of 100 characters.

operator
required
string

The POS operator (cashier) who submitted the check for accrual, usually by closing the check. Use "0" if the operator is unknown or unavailable.

receiptSettings
required
Array of arrays

List of receipt settings

http://example.com/api/v1/check/postAndAccruePointsWithRedeem

Request samples

  • Payload
Content type
application/json
{
  • "merchantId": 1107,
  • "storeCode": "corp",
  • "agentName": "PDQ POS",
  • "check": { },
  • "cardInfo": { },
  • "autoActivateCard": false,
  • "terminal": 1,
  • "operator": 0,
  • "receiptSettings": [ ]
}

SimulateAccrualAndRedemption

Simulate posting a check with redemption

The check simulate accrual and redemption request is similar to the post and accrue points with auto-redeem request, with the difference that no points or rewards are actually applied. Instead, this endpoint takes in a check (with the same parameters as in the previous endpoint) and additionally a list of already applied rewards, the manner in which rewards are to be selected (either automatic or manual and specified with the request), and the details of the receipt printer associated with the request. If successful, it will return the applicable discounts (see DiscountItem), a list of attempted rewards that cannot be applied (including any previously applied rewards that are no longer applicable) and a new receipt text.

Authorizations:
bearer_auth
Request Body schema: application/json
required
merchantId
required
integer

Paytronix-assigned merchant ID to perform the operation in.

storeCode
required
string

A short code to uniquely identify the store where this transaction occurred.

agentName
string

The agent name. Used if a store has more than one POS system.

check
required
object

POS check to post.

required
object (cardInfo)
autoActivateCard
required
boolean
Default: false

True if the card should automatically be activated if it is not already active. Defaults to false

terminal
required
string

Number of the POS terminal where the check was submitted for accrual, usually by closing the check. Use "0" if the terminal is unknown or unavailable. Maximum of 100 characters.

operator
required
string

The POS operator (cashier) who submitted the check for accrual, usually by closing the check. Use "0" if the operator is unknown or unavailable.

required
object (rewardSelectionMode)
required
Array of objects (potentialUnitItems) >= 1

A sequence of items which are dispensed by weight or volume and which are available to the guest. This is separate from items which have already been inserted into the check.

required
Array of objects (receiptSettings) >= 1

List of receipt settings

required
Array of objects (walletInformation) >= 1

List of discounts that have been applied to potential unit items

http://example.com/api/v1/check/simulateAccrualAndRedemption

Request samples

  • Payload
Content type
application/json
{
  • "merchantId": 1107,
  • "storeCode": "corp",
  • "agentName": "PDQ POS",
  • "check": { },
  • "cardInfo": {
    • "printedCardNumber": 11235813213455,
    • "trackInfo": "1234567432131792=4711101792000",
    • "phoneNumber": 9195551212,
    • "barcode": 11235813213455,
    • "appleNfcVasPayload": 11235813213455,
    • "googleNfcVasPayload": 11235813213455,
    • "accountToken": 11235813213455,
    • "cardRegCode": 1234,
    • "identificationMethod": "ACCOUNT_QUERY"
    },
  • "autoActivateCard": false,
  • "terminal": 1,
  • "operator": 0,
  • "rewardSelectionMode": {
    • "mode": "automatic",
    • "chosenRewards": [
      • {
        • "walletCode": 4382,
        • "amount": 1.25
        }
      ]
    },
  • "potentialUnitItems": [
    • {
      • "itemId": 1107,
      • "name": "Item 3",
      • "categories": [
        • {
          • "categoryType": "major",
          • "id": 123,
          • "name": "Regular Fuel"
          }
        ],
      • "pricePerUnit": 1.25
      }
    ],
  • "receiptSettings": [
    • {
      • "maxWidth": 40,
      • "name": "myReceipt"
      }
    ],
  • "potentialUnitItemDiscounts": [
    • {
      • "walletCode": 1,
      • "amount": 1
      }
    ]
}

SMS Enrollment

Enroll in SMS

Enrolls the phone number in SMS notifications from Paytronix

Authorizations:
bearer_auth
Request Body schema: application/json
required

Phone number to enroll

merchantId
required
integer

the merchant id provided by paytronix

phoneNumber
required
string

Phone number to enroll

activationStoreCode
string

Paytronix store code where the activation transaction should be performed.

http://example.com/api/v1/enrollment/smsEnroll

Request samples

  • Payload
Content type
application/json
{
  • "merchantId": 1107,
  • "phoneNumber": 3365040379,
  • "activationStoreCode": "corp"
}

Reverse transaction

Reverses a transaction

A reverse request is used to reverse a previous transaction. Only transactions that happened in the last seven days can be reversed. The transaction to reverse can be specified in the message by one of the following combinations of request fields:

  • The pxTransactionId from the original transaction reply
  • The pxAuthCode from the original transaction reply and the card info used for the original transaction
  • The posTransactionId and LP-code for the original transaction request type.
Authorizations:
bearer_auth
Request Body schema: application/json
required
required
object (headerInfo)
pxTransactionId
string

The pxTransactionId from reply to transaction to reverse.

pxAuthCode
string

The pxAuthCode from reply to transaction to reverse.

previousPosTransactionId
string

The pxTransactionId from transaction to reverse.

previousSequenceNumber
string

The sequenceNumber from transaction to reverse.

previousPosTransactionDatetime
string

The posTransactionDatetime from transaction to reverse

http://example.com/api/v1/transaction/reverse

Request samples

  • Payload
Content type
application/json
{
  • "headerInfo": {
    • "merchantId": 1107,
    • "storeCode": "corp",
    • "operatorId": 0,
    • "terminalId": 1023,
    • "posTransactionId": 999999,
    • "datetime": "2004-06-01T13:10:01.001",
    • "posTransactionDatetime": "2004-06-01 13:10",
    • "senderId": "POS",
    • "programId": "LP"
    },
  • "pxTransactionId": 123456789,
  • "pxAuthCode": 123456789,
  • "previousPosTransactionId": 123456789,
  • "previousSequenceNumber": 1,
  • "previousPosTransactionDatetime": "2004-06-01 13:10"
}
